wikipedia_page.main: George Worsley Adamson, RE, MCSD (7 February 1913 – 5 March 2005) was a book illustrator, writer, and cartoonist, who held American and British dual citizenship from 1931.

response: *Airborne Free: Red Devils & Other Rare Breeds. Mark Bryant, ed. London: Leo Cooper, Octopus Books (1990).  .   Description: observations on airborne forces and wildlife management by more than fifty cartoonists: George Worsley Adamson, Barry Fantoni, Alex Graham, Martin Honeysett, Peter Maddocks, Gerald Scarfe, Bill Tidy, Kevin Woodcock et al.   Royalties to the Airborne Forces Charities Development Trust and the David Shepherd Conservation Foundation.
